page.title: 14Pollution in the R. Girvan
page.content: On the{21st.of October 1980}the R. Girvan started to turn{red.}The cause was severe pollution from the Quarrelhill Burn near Dailly, into which had flooded water from coal mines closed in 1977. The{Dalquharran}mine in particular has iron pyrites in the coal seams and it was iron from this which had spilled into the burn and so to the R.Girvan itself. It was not long before the complete length of the river,{from Dailly to {the sea,}was a bright red colour. Iron was deposited on the rocks, on the banks and on the bridges and much river life was destroyed, including fish. Happily the mine overflow now has stopped, the river cleaned up, and the fish have returned.
